info.name: Defence Cart API Collection
info.description: Complete API collection for Defence Cart e-commerce platform with JWT authentication, categories, subcategories, products, user management, and CMS functionality.

item.name: üìù CMS Management
item.description: Content Management System APIs for managing website content, sections, and settings. This collection includes endpoints for managing all CMS sections: Hero, Header, Features, Customize, Who Can Join, Subscription Plans, Footer, SEO Settings, and General Settings. Each section can be fetched, updated, and managed independently. The CMS also supports media upload functionality and bulk operations.

item.name: üìö CMS Documentation
item.description:
üìñ **CMS Overview**

**Available Sections:**
‚Ä¢ **Hero Section**: Main landing page content with title, subtitle, description, CTA, and images
‚Ä¢ **Header**: Navigation menu, logo, company name, contact info, and auth buttons
‚Ä¢ **Features**: Highlighted features with icons, titles, and descriptions
‚Ä¢ **Customize**: Product customization section with video thumbnail
‚Ä¢ **Who Can Join**: Business categories (OEMs, MSMEs, Startups)
‚Ä¢ **Subscription Plans**: Pricing tiers and features
‚Ä¢ **Footer**: Company info, links, social media, and legal pages
‚Ä¢ **SEO Settings**: Meta tags, Open Graph, and search optimization
‚Ä¢ **General Settings**: Site-wide settings, colors, fonts, and maintenance mode

**Key Features:**
‚Ä¢ JWT authentication required for all operations
‚Ä¢ Support for bulk operations and maintenance mode
‚Ä¢ Media file management with tags and descriptions
‚Ä¢ Real-time preview and live editing
‚Ä¢ Version control and audit trails

**Authentication:**
All CMS endpoints require a valid JWT access token in the Authorization header:
`Authorization: Bearer {{accessToken}}`

**Common Actions:**
‚Ä¢ `GET /api/cms?section={section}` - Fetch section content
‚Ä¢ `POST /api/cms` - Update section content (action: upsert)
‚Ä¢ `GET /api/cms/dashboard` - Get CMS overview and statistics
‚Ä¢ `POST /api/cms/upload` - Upload media files
‚Ä¢ `DELETE /api/cms/upload/{fileId}` - Delete media files
